data.event: The legislative building is now located at the Sultan Kudarat municipality.

event.title: was created as one of the municipalities of Cotabato on August 8, 1947

data.event: Digal Lower Siling Maslabeng Poblacion Popol Talitay Upper Siling Dilag Salendab Malangit Tumbao Kayaga Tenok Kalman Buluan used to comprise a vast area surrounding Lake Buluan when it was created as one of the municipalities of Cotabato on August 8, 1947 by Executive Order No. 82 of Pres.

event.title: August 3, 1951, the municipality of Tacurong was created

data.event: On August 3, 1951, the municipality of Tacurong was created out of its south-western portion.
In 1961, its south-eastern portion was separated to form the municipality of Cotabato on, six years later its southern portion was made into the municipality of Lutayan.

event.title: six years later its southern portion was made

data.event: In 1961, its south-eastern portion was separated to form the municipality of Cotabato on, six years later its southern portion was made into the municipality of Lutayan.

event.title: was made part of the province of Maguindanao on November 22, 1973

data.event: It was made part of the province of Maguindanao on November 22, 1973, at the same time ceding its western coast of Lake Buluan to create the municipality of President Quirino, which was made part of Sultan Kudarat province.

event.title: was made into the municipality of Gen. S. K. Pendatun on April 7, 1991

data.event: Its northern portion was made into the municipality of Gen. S. K. Pendatun on April 7, 1991.

Its area was further divided on December 30, 2006, when two more municipalities were created out of its territory namely: Mangudadatu and Pandag, losing 8 barangays to each of the two new towns, effectively losing its Lake Buluan coastline to the former.
